alert.note: Alert for Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 6:44PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 643 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow thunderstorms. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches have fallen over this area during the last couple of days from previous storms. - Rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area with these slow moving thunderstorms this evening. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Palm Beach, Jupiter, Palm Beach Gardens, Riviera Beach, Juno Beach, North Palm Beach, Lake Park, North County Airport, The Acreage, Juno Ridge, Port Of Palm Beach, Mangonia Park, Fau North Campus, Lakeside Green and Caloosa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
